docs.lead_paragraph: Morris Schaeffer, a microbiologist and virologist who helped New York City rein in potentially hazardous medical laboratories in the 1960's and left his imprint on the national level as well, died on Jan. 4 at a hospital in Eugene, Ore. He was 89 and had moved to Eugene in 1988. He suffered a heart attack, the family said in a report of his death that was recently received.

headline.main: Morris Schaeffer, 89, Virologist Who Tightened Controls on Labs

docs.abstract: Morris Schaeffer, microbiologist and virologist, dies at age 89 (M)
